image.altText: A white man with short hair, sunglasses, a checkered button up shirt blue and grey, black blurred background.

props.synopsis: The trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright is continuing in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with a long-term friend of the Netflix star returning to the stand this morning.

title.children: Matt Wright's friend denies saying 'lawyer up boys' in secret recording

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The controversial Acacia system will be switched on at Alice Springs and Tennant Creek hospitals on Saturday, despite lingering doubts about the project's safety.

title.children: 'Unsafe' patient record system to go live at two NT hospitals

image.altText: A selfie image of three people, with the one on the right blurred. Two men on left, one older (left) and younger (right).

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of killing his father after a violent fight in the backyard of a suburban Darwin home has begun in the Northern Territory Supreme Court.

title.children: Trial of man accused of killing father in backyard begins in Darwin

image.altText: Brad and Jason Moon

props.synopsis: A family in the Northern Territory have quit their day jobs to focus on growing their passionfruit business.

title.children: Tradie's foray into passionfruit growing drives thriving family business

image.altText: Crocodile eggs in a tray with one that's pipped being held up by someone's hand.

props.synopsis:
The charges, laid by the Australian Federal Police, relate to alleged illegal activity at the NT's Kakadu National Park in early 2024.

Â

title.children: Two men involved in fatal chopper crash charged over stealing crocodile eggs

image.altText: A man stands in the sun on a green oval and smiles broadly as he holds a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: Eighteen-year-old Lesley Thompson will travel to Oslo for an international street soccer tournament that aims to challenge attitudes about homelessness.Â

title.children: Homeless Alice Springs man to play soccer for Australia in Norway

image.altText: A man with his face covered waves a black flag, on top of photos of Wisam Haddad and Youssef Uweinat and an image of a protest.

props.synopsis: Sydney cleric Wisam Haddad is working with a convicted terrorism recruiter to exploit the pro-Palestinian movement, radicalise Australian teens and feed Islamic State's revival, an ABC investigation reveals.

title.children: Jihadist spiritual leader Wisam Haddad is targeting the pro-Palestinian movement

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in press conference

props.synopsis: Multiple attendees at the economic reform roundtable have told the ABC there was a "heated exchange" between Treasurer Jim Chalmers and his shadow counterpart, Ted O'Brien. Follow live.

title.children: Jim Chalmers and shadow treasurer have 'heated exchange' at roundtable

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: States say they weren't told about Thriving Kids ahead of health minister's speech

States and territories will match $2 billion announced yesterday for Thriving Kids: Butler

image.altText: Bruce walks outside, flanked by others, wearing a blue suit, white shirt and pink tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: Yesterday, the Federal Court heard from representatives for Bruce Lehrmann, Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson as Mr Lehrmann appeals a ruling that he raped Brittany Higgins on the balance of probabilities. Today, the hearings resume.

title.children: Appeal hears Lisa Wilkinson was prepared to interview Bruce Lehrmann

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The difference between Ten's and Wilkinson's arguments
Burrows asked if she's challenging factual findings
Burrows denied more time by the court

image.altText: Aerial shot of white van in flood water

props.synopsis: Emergency service crews are on alert as heavy rain falls over parts of NSW that are still recovering from recent flooding.

title.children: More torrential rain, flooding forecast for large parts of NSW

image.altText: A man with grey hair in a military uniform looks out of a truck window across a desert landscape.

props.synopsis: As the IDF begins what could be the bloodiest phase yet of the war in Gaza, opposition to the conflict inside the IDF â both among leadership and the rank and file â is becoming more and more common.

title.children: As the IDF prepares to seize Gaza City, more reservists are refusing to serve

image.altText: Ukraine's ambassador to Japan Sergiy Korsunsky walks past a map.

props.synopsis: A decade ago, Donetsk was the metropolis of Ukraine's east. Now, Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly has it squarely in his sights.

title.children: The territories Putin wants and what it will mean for Ukraine

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: While the vast bulk of Australian housing is built for larger families, property research firm Cotality has found more than 60 per cent of households are made up of just one or two people.

title.children: Australian households living too large in major property size mismatch

image.altText: Michele Vanderlanh Smith on balcony holding a mug

props.synopsis: As insurance premiums across the country rise, insurers are posting bumper profits. Consumer advocates say policyholders have a right to know why.

title.children: The insurance 'black box' that's costing home owners thousands

image.altText: CBA logo

props.synopsis: CBA has apologised to 45 affected employees after finding customer service roles were not redundant despite introducing an AI-powered "voice-bot", but the union says the damage is done.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank backtracks on AI job cuts, apologises for 'error'

image.altText: Chinese President Xi Jinping shakes hands with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

props.synopsis: Nuclear-armed rivals India and China have agreed to resume direct flights for the first time in five years, ahead of a meeting between leaders Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping.

title.children: Trump's 'free gift' helping China rebuild relations with India

image.altText: A white man with short hair, sunglasses, a checkered button up shirt blue and grey, black blurred background.

props.synopsis: The trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright is continuing in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with a long-term friend of the Netflix star returning to the stand.

title.children: Matt Wright's friend claims he can't recall any requests to destroy documents

image.altText: A close up of Sally McManus in the Insiders studio.

props.synopsis: The treasurer's priority in this term has shifted from tackling cost of living to productivity and the unions are yet to score a victory.

title.children: So much for union 'stitch-up' predicted by Coalition ahead of roundtable

image.altText: Close up of red and green numbers on ASX board

props.synopsis: Australian shares are on the up despite the Nasdaq and S&P 500 falling overnight as investors sold tech stocks and moved into less highly-valued sectors.Â Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX 200 surpasses 9,000 points for the first time in broad-based rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 surpasses 9,000 points for first time
Mortgage arrears 'probably as good as we could have hoped for', says banking regulator

image.altText: Woman wearing glasses and a green, pink and blue shirt smiles.

props.synopsis: In university classrooms across the country, gynaecological cancer survivors are sharing their lived experience with health professionals to improve understanding and reduce delays in diagnosis.

title.children: Ovarian cancer signs can be overlooked. This program aims to change that

image.altText: a light aircraft on a field next to an airstrip without its landing gear

props.synopsis: A North Queensland MP says pilot error was to blame after the plane he was flying crashed after landing in Mount Isa.

title.children: MP Robbie Katter and pregnant wife walk away from crash landing

image.altText: A taxidermied wolf-like animal in a glass cabinet

props.synopsis: The search for what was killing sheep in South Australia's south-east caused a sensation across Australia. Questions remain about what type of animal it was.

title.children: Questions remain over Tantanoola tiger 130 years after it was shot dead

image.altText: Kassem in blazer and glasses, looking at paperwork

props.synopsis: Investors have been left wondering if they'll get their share of $33 million back from a health fund investor after it was purchased by another company.

title.children: 'My future is gone': Investors left in the dark after $33 million freeze

image.altText: A group of people sit around a long, oval table inside parliament house.

props.synopsis: The productivity roundtable's final day may prove the trickiest yet, as the conversation shifts from broad ambition to the hard realities of looming budget deficits and tax reform.

title.children: Productivity summit's final day turns to thorniest issues of tax and budget

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein appears in court.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump had called for the release of the transcripts amid rumours and criticism about his involvement with late financier long ago.Â

title.children: Judge rejects Trump administration's bid to unseal Epstein transcripts

image.altText: Donald Trump with one arm raised in a fist above his head.

props.synopsis: Meta, Citigroup, and local school districts are among the companies and government entities which the US president has bought bonds from in the past seven months, disclosure logs show.

title.children: Donald Trump buys $155 million in bonds in months since inauguration

image.altText: Small white star speck surrounded by a transparent greyish cloud against a black background.

props.synopsis: A supernova blast 2.2 billion light-years from Earth has given astronomers a deeper view into a star's centre than ever before.

title.children: 'Awestruck': Astronomers get first glimpse inside a dying star

image.altText: Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori celebrate by putting their heads together and shouting at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Italian pair Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori accomplish their "mission" by winning the US Open mixed doubles title for the second straight year in a controversially revamped format.

title.children: Defending champs complete 'mission' to upset singles stars to win US Open mixed doubles

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers clearning the bar in the high jump competition.

props.synopsis: Australian Nicola Olyslagers has defied the teeming rain to swan over the bar with just one bound and share the win in the Diamond League high jump in Switzerland.

title.children: Olyslagers soars in the rain to claim share of Diamond League win

image.altText: A group of penguins in front of ice formations.

props.synopsis: Scientists say there is emerging evidence of abrupt and potentially unstoppable changes in the Antarctic environment, heightening the risk of significant sea level rise and the extinction of species.

title.children: Scientists warn of 'abrupt changes' taking place in Antarctica

image.altText: Childcare CentreNondescript children

props.synopsis: Industry advocates say the federal government must do the heavy lifting when it comes to overhauling the child care sector.

title.children: Childcare safety is Australia's moment of reckoning, expert says

image.altText: An older woman wearing a hat with a 'GrannySaurus' name plate and a boy wearing a novelty hat and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A drunk driver who struck and killed 83-year-old Mary Kathleen Kelly on the Gold Coast is given a suspended jail term, as the victim's family continue to mourn the loss of her "contagious, exuberant energy".

title.children: Drink driver given suspended sentence over grandmother's hit-run death

image.altText: South Melbourne FC fans hold up scarves in the stands at an Australia Cup game.

props.synopsis: In a fixture dubbed The Big Show, more than 9,000 screaming fans packed this local football game in a sign these clubs could be ready for the A-League.

title.children: After packing out the 'Big Show', these clubs want a shot in the big leagues

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie

props.synopsis: An Uber driver who narrowly escaped death and the victim's violent criminal history are key pieces of a puzzle police are pouring over after Tuesday's shooting.

title.children: Sydney shooting victim's violent home invasion before death

image.altText: Joaquin Phoenix is on a phone call, dressed as a sheriff in the film Eddington.

props.synopsis: It might just about be the only thing the majority of the world agrees upon: Nobody wants to talk or even think about 2020. Enter Eddington: the wild, unpredictable fourth feature by Ari Aster, the American writer-director behind acclaimed horrors Hereditary and Midsommar.Â

title.children: Eddington is a deranged film about 2020
